Quality of Life

{% raw %}

to_int[source]

to_int(inp:Iterable, intonly=False)

returns items converted to int if possible keeps lists and tuples intact e.g. to_int(['-12', 2, 'a']) returns [-12, 2, 'a'] watch out because passing a string '12t' will be ripped into a list [1,2,t]

{% endraw %} {% raw %}
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
assert to_int(["12",2,'a']) == [12, 2, 'a']
assert to_int(["12",2,'a'], intonly=True) == [12, 2]
assert to_int([[[1],[-2,3]],[4,5,6]]) == [[[1], [-2, 3]], [4, 5, 6]]
assert to_int('bla 202') == ['b', 'l', 'a', ' ', 2, 0, 2]

watch out string will be converted into list of characters and single digit ints
{% endraw %} {% raw %}

ints[source]

ints(text:str)

Return a tuple of all the integers in a string

{% endraw %} {% raw %}
{% endraw %} {% raw %}

flatten[source]

flatten(x)

{% endraw %} {% raw %}
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
assert flatten([1,2,4,[99,33,[22,11]], 'f']) == [1, 2, 4, 99, 33, 22, 11, 'f']
assert flatten([[[1],[2,3]],[4,5,6]]) == [1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6]
{% endraw %} {% raw %}

reverse_dict[source]

reverse_dict(d)

{% endraw %} {% raw %}
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
a = {(0,0):'f'}
a |= reverse_dict(a)
assert a == {(0, 0): 'f', 'f': (0, 0)}
{% endraw %} {% raw %}

zippify[source]

zippify(iterable, len=2, cat=False)

Zips an iterable with arbitrary length pieces e.g. to create a moving window with len n Example: zippify('abcd',2, cat=False) --> [('a', 'b'), ('b', 'c'), ('c', 'd')]

If cat = True, joins the moving windows together zippify('abcd',2, cat=True) --> ['ab', 'bc', 'cd']

{% endraw %} {% raw %}
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
assert zippify('abcd',2, cat=True) == ['ab', 'bc', 'cd']
assert zippify('abcd',2, cat=False) == [('a', 'b'), ('b', 'c'), ('c', 'd')]
{% endraw %} {% raw %}

list_multiply[source]

list_multiply(a, b)

Multiplies two iterables elementwise Returns a list

Example: list_multiply([1,2,3],[2,3,4]) --> [2, 6, 12]

{% endraw %} {% raw %}
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
assert list_multiply([1,2,3],[2,3,4]) == [2, 6, 12]
{% endraw %}
